frameDefinitions: A particular Binding_principle is (or is not) operative, that is, any obligations, restrictions, and any other aspects of the Binding_principle are (or are not) in effect.
Under some Condition, usually left implicit, a Duty needs to be fulfilled by a  Responsible_party.
A Duty is imposed on a Responsible_party according to a Principle which regulates how the Responsible_party should respond to a Situation.
An Entity undergoes some change (the Event) that is (or is construed as) punctual.
Words in this frame describe the status of an Action with respect to a Code of laws or rules.
This frame concerns people being in an altered mental state that is induced by an Intoxicant.
frameExamples: This law will only become in <t>effect</t> during the last three weeks of the year.
It would <t>behoove</t> us to comprehend and personalize what Jesus had to tell his disciples
They escaped total Soviet invasion and occupation only by entering into a separate agreement that <t>obligated</t> them to military action against the retreating German armies.
This <t>happens</t> to me all the time.
<t>Illegal</t> drug use is on the rise.
listRoleDefinitions: The <fen>Binding_principle</fen> is the law, contract, principle, or other (set of) obligations that is (or is not) operational.
The <fen>Time</fen> at which the <fen>Binding_principle</fen> is in effect.
The <fen>Place</fen> at which the <fen>Binding_principle</fen> is or is not operational.
The action that the <fen>Responsible_party</fen> is obligated to perform.
The person who must perform the <fen>Duty</fen>.
The time interval during which the <fen>Duty</fen> is mandatory.
A location in which the <fen>Duty</fen>  obtains.
The person who must perform the <fen>Duty</fen>.
The action that the <fen>Responsible_party</fen> is obligated to perform.
The <fen>Obligator</fen> is the person who imposes the <fen>Duty</fen> on the <fen>Responsible_party</fen>.
A state of affairs that results in the <fen>Responsible_party</fen> being obligated to carry out the <fen>Duty</fen> in accordance with the <fen>Principle</fen>.
A regulating idea  (which may be instantiated as a document)  that the <fen>Responsible_party</fen> is subject to.
The time interval during which  the <fen>Duty</fen> is imposed on the <fen>Responsible_party</fen>  by the <fen>Obligator</fen> or the <fen>Situation</fen>.
A location in which the <fen>Responsible_party</fen> has a specified <fen>Duty</fen> .
This role identifies the event which occurs and affects the <fen>Entity</fen>.
This role identifies the entity, concrete or abstract.
This role identifies the time when the event occurs.
This role identifies where the event takes place.
The <fen>Action</fen> is the behavior which complies with or violates the <fen>Code</fen>.
The <fen>Object</fen> complies with or violates the <fen>Code</fen> by virtue of its existence, location or possession.
The mental state of the <fen>Cognizer</fen> is changed by an <fen>Intoxicant</fen> .
The <fen>Intoxicant</fen> alters the <fen>Cognizer</fen>'s mental experience.
The <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Cognizer</fen> becomes intoxicated.
listRoleExamples: Once <fex>the treaty</fex> is in effect, US port authorities and the Coast Guard will monitor compliance by checking any yacht 79 feet or longer.
All patent applicants and owners should be aware of the current uncertainty as to what patent fees will be in effect <fex>on October 1, 1998</fex>
This promotion is void <fex>in the state of Florida</fex>.
<fex>Getting a shot against yellow fever</fex> is obligatory for travellers to Benin.
The use of TM software is obligatory <fex>for every freelance translator working on projects for our company</fex>.
<fex>These days</fex>, wearing a seat-belt is mandatory.
Gymnasium is not obligatory <fex>in Sweden</fex>, but nearly everyone attends gymnasium
The winning bid committed <fex>her</fex> to paint an oil portrait for the high bidder.

Had she really said the word which pledged her <fex>to marry Horace Holmcroft in a
fortnight</fex>?
<fex>She</fex> pledged him to pay her the money back.
<fex>Admitting a genocide was occurring</fex>  would have obligated them, based on their signing the December 1948 Convention on the repression of genocide, to do something about it.
And <fex>no law</fex> obligated him to talk to the police, let alone the media

The City Council <fex>then</fex> obligated themselves to have the sewers made ready and the
streets leveled off without any additional cost to the Sisters.
<fex>At Dayton</fex>, the parties obligated themselves to respect and promote fulfillment of the annexes.
Illegal <fex>drug use</fex> is on the rise.

sourceCandidateSpans.text: the Association of periOperative Registered Nurses
the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
